review: I ate here over Labor Day weekend 2017 and I was not disappointed. I ordered one of the $6.99 cheeseburgers with bottomless fries and it was so good! The value can't be matched, especially at Easton. My husband ordered the same thing and we both ordered a soda; the bill before tip was $20--very reasonable.  In case anyone is wondering the $6.99 cheeseburger is as good as the $12 one, but just slightly smaller. It filled me up, but it also filled my husband up. We did not order a second serving of fries.

I've recently been to this particular location twice in the last year which is more than I had been the previous 6 years. Both times the food has been so so. It's really not that good and it's not just me. I've tried different items both times and the same goes for my husband. I know it's a cheap eats, but I don't think it is worth it.  Also, both times at this location has been terrible service. I mean terrible. Like we had to ask for refills, ask for silverware, ask for the bill, ask for the bill to be corrected (multiple times)... it has been a fiasco both times. The group we were with most recently frequents this spot and we asked that we start meeting somewhere else in the future cause it's not worth the hassle.

Not a place for someone who loves burgers and brews, ironically. Thus, don't let "Gourmet Burgers and Brews" lead you on. Granted, they don't say "craft brew," but what they have on draft is what every other dive bar has. The ONLY thing that sounded decent was a Bell's Brewery Two Hearted Ale, which was not on their board of brews (don't know why.) Thank goodness I asked the server (with fingers crossed) if there was anything else on tap other than what was on the board....(oh, and ask for a pint, because they'll give you a "giant" as default, apparently.) Speaking of, the server was nice, but it took five minutes to see a living soul and get seated for lunch at 11:30 on a Friday in an empty restaurant. No hostess at the front.... For a "gourmet burger" establishment, they can't cook a burger with pink. All around the table we order five burgers, pink in the middle/medium rare--delivered all well done. A $12 price tag REALLY stings in a place like this, no matter how many free steak fries they deliver to your table. In an area with other restaurants that specialize in the same and do SUCH a great job at it, I'm not sure how this place stays open. They're good for lunch groups and have milkshakes. Maybe that's it....

The highlight was the food,  The low point was the service - or lack thereof. My hubby got a burger.  It was good but smaller than before.  It was also a good thing he ordered more fries as soon as our food arrived as we didn't see our waitress again or very often for a LONG TIME.  I sat with an empty glass the entire time we waited for our food. She never checked with us so I could get a refill. My salad was OK.  It came with garlic toast which was a joke - 2 little pieces of thin toast, smaller than saltines.  Pathetic. It took forever for us to flag down our waitress so we could pay and leave.  And the restaurant was by NO MEANS busy.  We were seated a few minutes before 5 pm. I will hesitate before returning to this location - which is a shame.  It's very close to home.

Great service and great food. I had a Royal Robin burger and it was delicious. A member of our party had chicken tenders another a standard burger. The fries were awesome hot and delicious  Price is good and family atmosphere

We have been going to this location for 7+ years and today will be our last. It used to be clean with great food and friendly service. Now it's dirty, food is mediocre and you're lucky if you get a "hi" when you walk in the door. My husband and i used to LOVE going there and always felt we got our money's worth. We used to get the onion ring tower which was huge and now it's half the size. I always get the Avo-Cobb-O salad and today the avocado wasn't even on it. We told our waiter who then had his manager take half off the price which was nice. The second to last time we were in...we left after waiting 30mins. Reason for that being the hostesses looked/acted like they could've given two flips wether we got seated or not. There were empty table just sitting with food on them and no one did anything about it.  One hostess even was laying her head down on the podium! Today when we were seated there was a dirty knife and food still under our table. Then during our whole meal we got to stare at food and trash under tables. And people were sat at them!! With out them being cleaned!! The bathrooms are a disaster. The women's handicap stale door is hanging on by a thread and my husband said the men's wasn't any better. When we left, what I'm assuming was the manager as he had on a dress shirt, didn't even look up from the podium to say goodbye to us.  I hope this location gets its act together.

I went to this location last night (Sunday evening) around 6:30pm. I enjoy Red Robbin because of their wonderful gluten free options so I was excited to try out the RR at Easton. It fell short. First of all, there was a 15 minute wait when there were several open tables. The service was also lackluster. It wasn't necessarily bad, per se, it just wasn't up to par with the amount of guests in the restaurant. Our server greeted us and brought our drinks, but only checked on our table once. Three other servers waited on us: one for a second round of drinks, one for our meal, and one for a round of French fries. The initial server only greeted us and brought us our check.  He didn't check on us during our meal at all. He also said, as he gave us our check, "If you want me to keep my job, give me a 10/10." My father-in-law wasn't impressed. My FIL stated, "it was hard for me to even tip 15%." I felt that was odd, considering our server didn't even attempt to go out of his way to be friendly to us.  The reason I'm giving Red Robbin at Easton 3 stars is because their food was absolutely delicious! My fries were hot and fresh. My grilled chicken sandwich was one of the best I've ever had and their gluten free bun is to die for! I will always be a patron at RR because, even if their service is in decline, their food is worth it! I'll eat here again.

Wednesday Dec 20, Stopped in with 2 foster teens.  Their first time there.  Server was super energized and not only welcomed us but helped kids order and feel comfortable.  Good food, timely, hot. Server refilled drinks, French fries and went over and above accommodating us!  Kids loved the "campfire sauce with their fries!!! Restrooms clean as well as overall appearance of the restaurant.  Thank you for your kindness

Overall, this is a good place for a low cost meal. Took family here that just flew into CMH. The amount of menu items is a little over the top and some of the combinations are weird. The boneless wings, however, were nice and crispy. We came at an early time so we basically had the whole restaurant to ourselves.

Don't bother!  Unfriendly bar staff and salmon was over cooked and broccoli was undercooked!  Busy so we sat at bar but expected to be served with a "smile".  Guest next to me ordered a burger but it too was over cooked and he requested a new one to be made, waitress/bar staff was not pleased. Where's the Christmas spirit?

I've eaten here many times before but Red Robin is quickly becoming one of my favorites.  I'm officially back on my low carb lifestyle and have been reduced to Phase 1 eating of straight protein and limited veggies. Eating out is a challenge and I have to ask the staff a million questions just to be sure I'm eating prop foods with no sneaky ingredients. They were all so patient, attentive, and pleasant!  It was busy my last visit but we were seated immediately in the bar area where there was full service from the wait staff. My waitress was new, day 4 of training; she did a great job with help from a senior waitress. They seldom came together but we're in tune and regularly replaced our drinks without asking (I had iced tea w/sugar free syrup from the bar). They gave suggestions on food and alternate options, given my diet. I had the bunless Wedgie burger with guacamole, onions, added pepper jack cheese, and it was wrapped with darn near a full head of iceberg lettuce. I was craving the bottomless fries (no can do) but was informed the salad and a few other sides are also bottomless...and I took my last serving as left overs. My tea was bottomless as well.  I walked out feeling satisfied for the first time in a week and since it was my birthday month and I'm part of their club I got my meal for free. They gave me a small cup of whipped cream for desert  Yep, 20 pounds to lose so guess where I'll be eating...

The service was unbelievably horrible! We walked in and requested a table and the hostess acted confused and took awhile to finally figure out where to sit us, the place was pretty empty. Then our waitress rudely asked if we were ready to order and she snapped back saying "are you ready to order", we said no but wanted to put kids orders in and she had abruptly walked away before taking the kids orders. The entire time we felt like we were an inconvenience to her. We then listened to her yell into the kitchen about another order, requesting crisper fries for the table sitting right next to us , demanding better fries. All seemed very unprofessional to do in front of customers. Overall I felt a lack of professionalism and will not return.

Terrible service and terrible staff working the phone. While we did order an order to go, the $43 ticket was filled out properly, but the inability to read the ticket by the staff led to half of our order being unable to be consumed do to a food intolerance issue. There were other more minor gross issues, but the problem came when we called the location for resolution.  Calling in, we spoke to a young girl who refused to let us speak to a manager regarding the food we received being wrong/ not as ordered. The person refused to listen to us and said they did not want to hear about the issues we had and hung up the phone. So it being a weekend, I have called to leave a messaged for MaryEllen at the corporate office 1-877-733-6543 option 9. I really hope to hear back as this was a place I and my immediate and extended family have gone for birthdays in the past. I don't show up with coupons (even though my email is full of offers) and I tip my servers no less than 20-25%. At this point I don't believe Red Robin cares about the quality and accuracy of what they serve. Just the numbers that come through the door. I can get less expensive crap from Wendy's or the McDonald's, even the Roadhouse next door to this place. I don't like giving bad reviews, as there is never a 100% perfect service over a long enough timeline. But seeing as how this was handled with the restaurant with no one raising their voice or getting mad. At this point I am severely disappointed with the response and find it odd that companies are willing to throw away business and word of mouth recommendations over $20 in food they failed to prepare properly. In a city like this, there are more options people have to go to and places willing to take feedback.

I ventured back here, after management was kind enough to reach out to me after my last visit. At first, everything was all good! We were seated promptly even though the restaurant was busy, and our server Cameron was very polite and friendly. We ordered onion rings as appetizers and some drinks...and that's when the trouble began. Our onion rings and drinks were out quickly..but we took one look at the plates they were on and balked. The serving sides was covered in a layer of grease almost as if they had been wiped off and not actually washed. And the back of the one of the plates had a giant blob of ketchup on it. Mind you, there was no ketchup on the table in bottle or blob form. It definately was a remnant on the plate.This was only noticed after my boyfriend had stuck his fingers in it. I hate being critical after a restaurant has taken the time to reach out to me. I really wanted to like this place and give it another go, especially after the manegment tried to make my last visit right, but after the previous experience and the plates, I couldn't bring myself to stay any longer. Once again (for the last time)I left red robin hungry and dissapointed.

Generally, Red Robin is one of my favorite family dinners locations.  The one at Easton Town center was pretty awful.  The waitress was very pleasant with everything, but wasn't very attentive.  The major issue appears to be the kitchen.  One meal (chicken fingers) came out after everyone else was finished with their food and it was cold.  Maybe it was left on the serving line for that long, but it didn't seem so.  When it was brought to the managers attention, her attitude was apathetic.  She did bring out fresh food and it was hot the second time.  I always get sweet potatoes fries with my meal and the ones that come with my meal were barely warm, but the refill was hot. Overall the experience was pretty bad.  We were there for over three hours and that wasn't because we were just hanging out.

Management must train the staff to not refill fries more than once. Burger was cool, spent the extra buck to get garlic fries, and was offered a refill once. After that we were quickly given the check and avoided for the rest of the night. I wanted to get a refill one more time before we left so I waved at the waitress. She looked at me, made eye contact, and then just walked past me without acknowledging me. I've never been straight up ignored by a waitress before and I even gave her a heads up that I was going to eat more fries when she delivered the bill. What bothered me most was the waitress straight up ignoring us after dropping off the bill so soon. That's not a way to train staff and we won't be back at this location. I can go to a nicer restaurant to get a better burger for over $10 that at least won't lie to me about "bottomless fries" to justify the price.

Recently I ate here as a back up as all of the restaurants at Easton Town Center had long waits. I had only been to a Red Robin once before, about 6 years ago, and was not a fan. However, things have changed in a great way.  Our service was top notch, and they seated us right away.  I had the southern charm burger with onion rings. It was amazing. It was very well seasoned, cooked exactly how I ordered, and the glaze set it over the top.  Everything is very well priced.  There was plenty of free parking too.

I love good burgers and yes, the Red Robin chain has been on my 'to try' list for years. So, recently after listening to the RR episode of the Podcast 'Doughboys', I finally made a trip to the nearby Easton location for lunchables with my Bro. This place sits to the entrance to the Easton Market shopping plaza with parking in the rear. I can't tell you much about the interior since we chose to score a patio table on this perfect Ohio Fall day. Our server was quick to get our drink order and give us time to read through the huge catalog of a menu they have here (The weight of the menu in Burger terms = about Wendy's Baconator Triple). Outside of their main draw, the burgers, they offer a wide array of menu choices, and while that can be either a good or bad thing, I decide to play it safe and go with the one thing they advertise to be. My choice, the Royal Red Robin, a bacon cheeseburger with a perfectly cooked fried egg on top, my favourite combination wherever I can find it and this burger did not disappoint. Paired it up with the 'bottomless' Garlic herb fries, which were the house steak fries tossed in a garlic oil with herbs and Parmesan cheese. Truly a garlic lovers treat but, one serving was enough for my bottom and I spent the rest of the day with garlic on my 'flavour saver' 'stache.   For a First time visit to this chain this location scored a Win for their Team and I'll be back for another round...

Hey man, it's pretty good, and the 'endless' sides came in handy since we have kids that we can feed from that bottomless trough until they get full, but bro, $11 for a burger? Don't get me wrong, they're good, but not $11 good. If that burger was $6-$8, then now we're talking, but at near-as-makes-no-difference twice that price? Ugh. I'll come back if I have to.

I went with a friend on a Friday night around 730. We saw lots of people milling about outside and inside and I figured everyone was waiting for a seat but when we went in to check, we were seated immediately. I had a simple burger with lettuce, tomato and cheese cooked with a little bit of pink. My friend had a beer. The burgers here are pretty good for a big chain. They will definitely satisfy a burger craving. AND you get bottomless fries which is kind of unique. The steak style fries are actually pretty good too. I like them.  What I did not like was all of the yelling at the customers that happens there because of the horrible layout of this place. If they seat you in the center of the restaurant where all of the 2 people booths are and towards the back near the kitchen, then you will have to walk all of the way to the front of the restaurant, then all of the way to a back corner to use the restroom.  The booths near the kitchen are right next to the bathroom. Instinct tells you to cut through the waitstaff area to get to the toilet which is super close. You are not allowed to do this. There are signs saying do not enter and if you do (and it takes about 5 steps to do so), you will get yelled at. Later, as we were leaving, they had blocked off the center aisle that led straight to the exit. I have no idea why, but when we tried to leave, we got yelled at and told to take a detour to the side of the restaurant, then to the front. Before leaving, you can hear waitstaff yelling at customers who were trying to go the bathroom or trying to leave. The wait staff seemed to spend more time yelling at people than filling drinks or french fries. There are better burgers out there, but you probably won't find bottomless fries.  I'd go again if you were buying and driving. And we didn't sit in the middle aisle.

Great food. Awesome service.  Went here for lunch with friends. It was a great time. Got the hamburger done the way I wanted it. Had the fries they were good. I like mine crisper but had plenty with the refills if wanted.  Server was attentive and staff checked back often to see if we needed anything or

Not sure why I enjoy Red Robin so much. Probably because I have found the food consistent, the atmosphere casual and the menu appealing to many. All an all an easy choice when you need one.  One menue item often mentioned are the fries, garlic, sweet potato and steak cut, which are bottomless and served hot as you request more. I believeyou can also get bottomless broccoli if that is more your styl. But their Red Robin seasoning (avaliable for sale at the bar) is just too yummy with its unhealthy salty, sugaryness. Oh and be sure to look into the dipping sauces. During our most recent visit, our server suggested the bacon aoli and I think my brother fell in love. And now I must admit that I am lame and always order their bruschetta chicken sandwich. But hey I have enjoyed it each and every time so that says something for itself.  Based on location etc. there will be days you'll find the wait to be seated varies from none to 30min+, and the dinning areas can be quiet to humming rather loudly. They also have those new fangled table top computers that allow you to page your server and pay/leave when you wish, but our servers have by and by been on the ball. The Red Robin card has also been nice for earning free burgers and receiving a birthday sunday, among other promotions.

We visit Red Robin at least 1-2 times every few months. The burgers are always cooked well, and they offer many options and flavors. I recently tried the wedgie burger since im trying to get back in shape a little. Its lettuce wrapped in place of a bun. I have to admit...It might be my new favorite. The lettuce added a while new taste and texture to the sandwich. And the bun wasnt missed AT ALL!! My main gripe with Red Robin is that the changed the decor of the locations. I liked it much better when it was more family oriented. With the costumed bird walking around and all. Now its just seems like they are trying to be a more serious spot.

The dining experience  at Red Robin was very disappointing. My family and I came to this restaurant to celebrate my son's 8th birthday and the food and service were spectacularly lackluster. Sadly,  It is getting more difficult to find a restaurant with that rare combination of good food and great service. I  didn't mind the long wait for my food but after waiting for an hour and getting COLD food I will never patronize this establishment again. This just happened. 6:02 pm - 7:31pm. We'll settle up now!! We can't get out of here fast enough Signed, Disappointed Dad

They always seem to be really stingy with offering all you can eat fries. Then they bring a basket with about 10 French fries. Then make you feel bad about asking for more. If you advertise all you can eat fries, then bring em on! Their potatoes not gold! Can't be that much waste corporate wide to be that stingy.

The restaurant itself is really nice and much bigger than any other Red Robin location I've been to. On a busy Friday evening we were seated in probably fifteen to twenty minutes. Again not bad for a Friday night. It looked like they could probably use a couple more servers throughout the restaurant because our server who did well, was really busy with a lot of tables. We ordered chips, salsa,  & guacamole as our appetizer, which in my opinion took over 15 minutes to come out, which is a little long for a no cook appetizer.  I ordered my Red Robin standby, The Royal Red Robin. The burger as usual was excellent. My pet peeve about Red Robin recently is it seems they are getting stingy with the fries. The burgers are served with a side of like 8 to 10 fries. I have those finished off in less than a minute. Our sever was on top of getting us refills, although the refills took a little long to come out. I also ordered the endless Root Beer Float, which was excellent, but endless means endless. I received one refill. I could have easily drank six, no joke. Good good, fair service, nothing exceptional about the place.

just another red robin. average burger, average service and still had the nerve to suggest a 20% tip. i thought the days of servers coming out and clapping and singing happy birthday were over but it still reigns supreme here at red robin. I had my meal at the bar and i swear that their was an employees sitting at the table with his fellow employees and he had rubber gloves on...why??? they all are sitting at a table and it's a mess, don't they realize that they are in view of customers...everybody is on there phones...first time, last time

Why we keep going back, I will never know!!?? My family and I have been the recipients of bad service and mediocre food on a few occasions. Over the summer the air ducts were dripping right over my wife's head but when we asked to be moved we were told that they had no other table to move us to. Not a single offer to make it up through a discount, coupon, etc....just a sorry- it's summer and humid. Like the schmucks we are we paid the bill in full and didn't complain. The service is generally slow but the ability to pay using the tabletop kiosk is awesome! One of the reasons that I go back. My kids love it so I took them to this location after their hockey practices. We waited for about 10 minutes to be seen by a waitress. She was very pleasant and took our entire order at once, which was helpful. I received my drink immediately but it took about 10 more minutes for my kids to get theirs. The food came out at a decent time but it was wrong. My youngest' order was not right and when I mentioned it to the server she seemed surprised. The order, kids pizza, did come out but it was nothing more than garlic bread-burnt garlic bread- with cheese. The server was apologetic and did bring out fries so he could eat before the pizza came but it's one too many times. I won't be back to this location. They are clearly overwhelmed and unable to keep up with any sort of heightened business- this was not the case tonight as it seemed very slow.  The server was polite, not overly attentive, but polite.
Server was great and was attentive to our requests.  Food was good and the fries kept coming.

We decided to drop by to get the wife's free burger for her birthday i really love that they give you the whole month of your bday to redeemed it and just not only on that day. The food was really good and service was pretty fast as well. I love that you get bottomless fries and the campfire sauce is to die for. I ordered my burger medium well and it was cook perfectly. Next time I'm in the area i will stop by and grab me a burger.

The service tonight was terrible. But, I don't believe it was mostly the server's fault. She was ok. Example - It took 20 minutes to get mustard. Apparently there was none on the floor. It took just as long to get a refill on snazzy lemonade and to get some ranch that was originally ordered. Overall, it was a waste of money.  Apparently the good crew members went to the new Pickerington location. Management needs to get this one fixed. This is a prime location and should have a prime restaurant.

I enjoy the relaxed family-style atmosphere of this joint. This time round, my niece picked this restaurant for her birthday dinner with the family. We decided to meet at 5:30, thus we're seated right away. The waitress was polite.  This time round, I decided on the Bonsai Burger. Regular classic cheeseburger, except a teriyaki sauce and a slice of pineapple top it off. A side of sweet potato fries to accompany. Results? Thought the burger (meat) was nicely grilled - slightly pink throughout the center, and juicy. The downside was too much teriyaki sauce. It almost totally masked the flavor of the burger. And the sweet potato fries? Well, I LOVE sweet potatoes, thus any place that serves good, quality SPF has my heart... And this places sticks were NOT good :( a large amount of the fries were outside slices. Way over cooked, too. Couldn't taste sweet potato at all. Definitely disappointed this time around.

Seated immediately and server didn't take too long to get there. She did the bare minimum, but wasn't friendly, nor did she stop by other than mandatory visits- order, food drop off, check drop off. BUT, drink order was right, food order was right. Honestly, the busser who dropped off my extra broccoli was nicer and more engaging, though the waitress seemed to have an issue with me asking him for it (maybe she should have stopped by :/). Regardless, a better experience than the other one, but their new management may change that.

Overall it's a nice, fun place to go with friends and family, if you're there from 12-1, or 6 pm on, then it's busy, and the waitstaff seems overwhelmed, understandably, because the place is packed and people are loud. We've been coming here for over 3 years, and the food is always great and 95% of the time, we've had great service. I like the new decor, the old was very tacky. I do wish that servers would be careful not to sit people who do not have children, next to those who do. It's honestly the reason I don't go there more often. There's always a chance you'll be seated by screaming children. I like being able to customize everything, and the bottomless fries are great because if someone's still hungry, that's easily fixed without having to spend more money. Their rewards program is great!
The change in in decor makes it a place we will not come back to. The old saying "why fix it if it's not broken" applies directly to this place. Extremely warm and unfriendly staff

good food.. but I think we had the worse waiter I've ever had! He brought our salads after our food had arrived. He refilled our glasses the ONE time he came to our table. When my husband told him he didn't provide us with good service , it went to a whole new level.. he then kept coming to our table.. telling us he's been doing this for 23 years. my husband finally got mad and told him it was over to move on. He then offered to buy our dinner. We declined his offer and again asked him to please forget it and to move on. He then asked us "Do you fucking look down on me cause I'm a server?" Holy shit!! this guy has major issues. He then cleaned off a knife while at our table and gestured as if he was going to use it. My husband then asked for the manager. I'm not sure what the outcome of this will be, but he shouldn't ever serve another customer. He needs mental help. BTW his name was Jim. please if you visit this restaurant don't let Jim know he's not a great waiter. He might threaten you as well!!!  UPDATE: Public Relations called me to let me know they would be having someone call me in 7 to 14 Days.. it's been OVER 30 days.. still no call.. funny how there was nothing done.

Onion rings and the sauce is amazing!!! Pig out Tavern double add fried egg and onion straws and eat with the onion ring sauce, best burger I've eaten in my opinion! So easy and great to eat, I'm not a big fan of tall burgers and very huge patties. So Red Robin is my go to place for a great burger and fries!!!

I wish there was a negative star review!  My 2 girls and I waited for 20 minutes to be seated and watched 2 parties that came in after us get seated before us. There were 3 girls standing at the hostess stand giggling and talking and they blatantly skipped over us. We left and we will never go back in there again!!
Went here to have a nice dinner with my family. Service was slow and food came cool. The worst part was when I attempted to change my baby in the restroom and found a man past out from shooting up.

Hands down my go to place for a good burger.  They might not be the best of the best burgers ever, but they are pretty darn good and have always been consistent.  Yes, there are a few other burger places around town that I really love too and think do a great job, but RR's has been around so long, I always know I can come here and get what I'm expecting.  I like getting the Bacon sauce with my fries.  And bottom less fries are nice, I honestly have probably only gotten extra fries once, I'm usually pretty darn full after a good burger.

Did the burgers get smaller?  I hadn't been to Red Robin in a good number of years (at least 3) and I swear the burgers are smaller.  I ordered the Fiery Ghost burger and it was actually pretty good, but seemed small, I even upgraded it to the "larger" one. Opted for coleslaw as a side, the first serving was under-dressed and the second serving was absolutely swimming in dressing. The service was fine but the addition of the checkout tablet device at the tables kind of makes things a little more impersonal.

Very very happy with food and service here. Still a little sore over the change in decor. It was really fun to go to Red Robin. The decor was fun and cheerful. Now they are like most other establishments like Chili's, Max & Erma's, and Applebee's. Wish they would go back to the old decor.

I like Red Robin. The problem is the competition. The burgers aren't better than 5 guys which is cheaper and better and we have Thurman's Cafe. The one thing that Red Robin offers is good gimmick drinks and some good appetizers. If you are going strictly for food. Thurman's is my recommendation. Better burger, better appetizer at a cheaper price.

Not gonna lie, this has been my favorite veggie burger place for YEARS. They have both Gardenburger and Boca parties and will sub them out on any burger but I just stick with the original gardenburger menu option-the Dijon sauce is so good! The steak fries are great, too. Try them dipped in mayo. And the iced tea is very good. Free refills on both fries & tea. Good, consistent service!  Oh, but go on off hours unless you don't mind lots of families with kids and the chaos that comes with!

Sat outside with my wife and two boys on a very nice and not busy at all evening.  For twenty minutes we watched two waitresses taking care of the other three tables while giving us blank stares on each pass.  Walked next door to Logan's where we had our drinks and orders in within ten minutes.

I came in today around 8.30 pm to enjoy a nice burger with a friend. Unfortunately, I ended up leaving and going to another restaurant, because nobody would greet me or offer me a table. After waiting several minutes watching staff go around cleaning tables, ringing up checks, and singing happy birthday while totally ignoring the host stand and hungry customers, I called the restaurant. I explained the situation to the man who answered the phone while two staff members well within earshot continued to ignore me, even looking right at me without the slightest acknowledgment. He apologized, but no one came. As I was getting off the phone with him a staff member looked at me and walked into the dining area.  So, I  went to Logan's and was immedistely greated with a smile and seated. I don't think Red Robin is a place I feel like visiting again with so many other choices.

You had me at bottomless french fries! This evening service was phenomenal...  Natasha was on top of everything while keeping us laughing. I LOVE that they offer fried zucchini, however.. the spears were a little too thick leading to 1. them being VERy hot 2. grease running down my chin.  Still tasty though. Their flavored lemonades are YUMM! They offer a rewards card which seems to have great value.

Red Robin has my vote for best restaurant burger.  Prepared just the way I like it.  My waiter, Drew, was so friendly and took good care of us.  For dessert, I helped eat a chocolate mouse cake and it was so big and delicious.  It may seem a little noisy at times but I could tolerate it.  The pretzel bite appetizer is good.  Try it out!

Blar-ram-ewe.  Hmm; there is some good here.  The service was solid, 4-5 area, and the prices aren't turrible, most burger meals are in the $10-12 range, and comes with bottomless fries (not like THAT you dirty sots!).   Took my sister here today, and we each got the Gourmet Burger.  I got mine with bacon and bacon aioli and swiss cheese.  The fries are actually quite good, steak fries which are well seasoned and tasty, and as I said before the service was quite good.  But the burgers were highly disappointing.  They reminded me of the old Burger King burgers, both size and grill.  They cannot cook to order, so no medium rare.  They weren't bad, but I'd rate them under Flipside and B Spot by a significant margin, and even prefer those found at Smashburger and Steak & Shake.   I hate rating it a two, because the service was fine, and the atmosphere is just fine.  Plentiful boothing, some moderate tables, a bar to the right and plenty of helpful servers.  Both solid 4s.  But the actual burgers, and the value?  Just not there.  I'd far rather drop the $8 at Smashburger or the $10-12 at Flipside or B Spot (all sans fries, mind) than re-visit.  It really is a shame, as I had fond memories of the Royal Red Robin Burger (egg on a burger is always a win), but it just didn't hold up over time.  Keep in mind there are other menu items which might redeem; the cod sandwich looked tasty, and I did not partake in any of their appetizer options.  Just don't expect the burger to impress.

I came over for dinner tonight.  It's an enourmous building.  It wasn't full but they were pretty busy.  The good thing is that I had a great waitress (Valerie).  She anticipated everything that I wanted. I ordered the bacon cheese burger with steak fries and a salted caramel shake.  The fries were nice sized and they give you free refills on them but I didn't take one.  The shake was pretty good also.  The hamburger wasn't so hot.  Even though it was cooked to order (medium) it seems that it was made in a press and had the life squeezed out of it.  No pickles on the side or on the sandwich either.

I ordered my burger well done and the waitress looked at me and said pink or no pink... I said well done and she said we only do pink or no pink and of course it came out with pink... She dropped off the food and our drinks were almost gone. She said I'll be back with drinks.. Mean while we had about 10 fries each. I thought well when she brings the drinks I'll order more fries. We didn't  see her until she brought the bill and 2 to-go cups.   I said well it likes were leaving. She wanted to give us fries to go. We declined left her 15% instead of the normal 20 and decided to never return to this location. Love Red Robin but not this one...

New burger this season. Southern Charm Burger. Ground beef patty cooked to your liking, covered in some sort of amazing glaze, sharp cheddar, sautéed onions and wait for it......wait for it.....CANDIED BACON!!!! Served on a toasted fluffy bun. Onions, tomatoes if u want. Ugggggggggg!!!!! This BURGER IS AMAZING!!!!!!! Try it :) smooches

I am not jumping on the chain gang just yet....but Red Robin is a-ok! They have consistently good burgers. Bottomless fries are a pretty sweet deal. There is a variety of dipping sauces - each with a unique flavor. A couple of beers on tap and shakes on top of regular drink choices. You can get away with lunch under $10. Another consistency at Red Robin is slow service. It's a bummer but a fact of life. Oh well, guess you can't win them all.......or can you?

The food is up to its usual standard but they were back logged on fries and the coffee maker wasn't working. But we weren't charge for the coffee. We had to ask twice for some items like sweetener or spoons   The server was scary. She made us feel that we were inconveniencing her at times.  And we thought that a soup order would be served either before the burgers or with them. We had to ask three times for the soup.  If the service continues like this, we might look for a different speciality burger restaurant.

The service is always lacking in enthusiasm and friendliness but I keep going back because the food is so good. Burgers always cooked to perfection and bottomless fries make this restaurant an excellent value.
i love red robin burgers. Bleu ribbon burgers are the best!

Red Robin, in my opinion, has gone down over the years. I still enjoy their burgers, but it is not a place I absolutely have to go to. I have been going as of late for family get togethers. I always get the Whiskey BBQ Burger with fries. They do have delicious fries...I have to admit that.  4/5 stars

OK place to eat, there's just too much competition in the burger market to be charging as much as they do for a burger. The mini arcade is always an issue with the kids, the last time we went we were with another couple and their son, they couldn't say no to the arcade so to keep the peace we followed them and spent too much time there. We shouldn't have to explain to our son that we are there to eat and not to play games. We would go to a Game Works type place (which we have) for that.

My favorite burger joint at Easton. Love the choices between a chicken,veggie,or beef burgers.  I always go for the whiskey river chicken burger topped with cheddar,bbq sauce and crispy onion straws. Chicken was grilled and not over done My fellow diner was in the mood for beef and got the Southern Charm,a Angus patty,topped with cheddar,bacon,sweet barbecue sauce and candied brown sugar bacon,burger was cooked just as requested to medium well. The freckled lemonade is always a winner next time I will make it a grown-up drink with vodka.

The manager at this location is not likely to help with any concerns or issues.  We asked to be seated by the OSU vs ND game and all was well until they changed the channel mid game.  When we asked to have it changed back the lady at a table that was seated near us, but well after ours, had a fit and started yelling at us because she wanted a different game. No one asked her to stop.  Our food was not correct nor cooked to order and we just wanted to leave.  The manager did nothing about the yelling patron or the food - it was bad service, bad atmosphere and bad management! Finally, the burger is a thin piece of pre formed meat unfortunately we will not be returning.

I went to red robin last night it was very crowded and took us about 30 mins to eat the food was good but I ordered a very berry limeade the first one was good but didn't have a lot in it considering there was a cup load of ice..anyway a different server came a gave us our food and took my cup asking what I had I proceeded to to enjoy my meal but what did he come back with..a cup of water with whole strawberries.. Needless to say I was not happy but other than that the meal was good it was about 89$ for four people not that bad I would eat here again just no more limeade!
Really good burgers n shakes. Bottomless fries is a huge perk! Lots of sauces n affordable too. Great for the whole family

If you are in the mood for a good burger, Red Robin will satisfy your need. I almost exclusively get the A1 Peppercorn burger. Fantastic. One big improvement for me over the last few years is that they have phased out the practice of serving your burger and fries in a basket, and now finally serve it to you on a plate. Much easier to eat this way. Beer selection is good and the staff is friendly - worth a visit if you want a hamburger.

Management needs to pay closer attention to the smaller details. Cleanliness of tables, glassware and dinning room walls. I was disgusted by the soapy water I was served, the partial burger that was brought to our table and the food partials left on my glass. I thought about presenting my findings to the manager on site, but thought this was a better way to share my experience.

After getting no service across the walk, we came in to enjoy a birthday burger.  We got seated quickly, but it took forever for the waiter to show that we almost left. The place was not busy at all, but service was terrible. We saw our waiter a total of 3 times. Came way too late to offer free fries or to order another pint. And then I didn't even get a birthday sunday as it seems this year you only get the birthday burger and not a sunday. I don't think we are going to eat on this side of town for awhile
Ordered two burgers medium, got two burgers WELL done.  Server was loud mousey voice, very annoying. Server and as also slow with drink refills I will go to Flip Spot from now on for burgers

Eat at red robins all the time and this by far is the worst! Ordered a burger and fries, like I always do! Asked for fries while I waited for my burger, like I always do. Told we couldn't get fries before the meal. What?! This made my whole experience bad, I will never eat here again!

I'm a fan of Red Robin. They do have one of the better chain burgers I've had. This location wasn't any different. Good food and bottomless steak fries. My issue is with the staff and cleanliness. We sat in the bar area, right away we could tell the bartenders and wait staff were feuding. You could feel the tension, attitude and bickering between employees. Not only was it annoying, it slowed down their service. The mgr tried to defuse the situation but only got attitude in return. The kitchen end of the restaurant was dirty and unorganized. There were a couple tables that needed bussing. The floors were damp and very slippery. All in all it was an unorganized mess BUT I got endless steak fries......

It had been a few years since I've been to a Red Robin.  While my wife and I were out running errands a tasty burger sounded like a great idea.  I wish I went somewhere else. My entire expereince at the Easton Red Robin was a complete 180 from how I remember the place.  Our server (who also was a bartender I think) reached a new level of annoying.  I think he was trying to work on creating a cute catch phrase... or maybe his boss told him he needed to be more outgoing.. either way.. it was so over the top that I had to try my best not even make eye contact.  My favorite was his excited 'Soups On!' comment when bringing out our burgers.  We did not order soup and it was said exaggerated that it wasn't even funny. Our meal:  Fries - Since Red Robin is known for their fries as well their burgers and who can resist Sweet Potato Fries we both ordered the upgrade.  Both of were in a bit of shock when they came out.  They were cute about the size of McDonald's fries and burnt nearly to a crisp.  No flavor at all.  We were shocked that someone could even serve such bad looking fries.  When the server came back and asked if we wanted more of them (we each barely could touch them) I mentioned that they were burned and not good - he seemed shocked that we would not like them. Burgers - I ordered the Blue Ribbon burger and my wife had bacon cheese burger.  We both wanted to order medium rare but we were told the kitchen could not do that for us.  We both ordered Medium and were given close to well done.  Meat was dry and flavorless.  Mine had onion straws on the bottom of it - at least I think that was what was supposed to be there.. it looked and tastes more like the left over bits of batter after the onion rings were made.  Blue cheese had no flavor either.  My wife's burger same exepreince - over cooked with no flavor.  I remember Red Robin having incredibly juicy, tasty burgers. Overall - this place really has taken a turn for the worse.  When we ate it was 4:30 pm.  There may have been 3 other tables filled.. there was no rush.. no excuse for such a poor quality food.. or such a socially awkward server.

My wife and I visit this location about once a month and are generally pleased with the food; however our last experience with the service was exceptionally poor.  We had to ask other servers for silverware and re-fills.   It took forever to get our check.   Our tablet was not working so we could not check-out at our table.   As throughout the evening, we could not locate our server.  I guess the restaurant relies on the tablets for check-out, but when they don't work you are stuck.   Once again we had to rely on another server to get our check and it took forever.

Gourmet Burgers my butt! Really, I don't get the hype about Red Robin, bad service and worse food. The towering onion rings at $8 is a rip off, the avo cabo salad lacks any flavor and it a waste of money. My husband had the A1 burger which was also flavorless, and the all you can eat fries you get are also just plain and boring and by the time you flag down your waiter and get a refill, you are done with your food and who wants to eat just fries? I swear they do that on purpose.
This burger joint is the bomb, can't go wrong with bottomless fries and awesome burgers and chicken sandwiches!!

Been here 2x now. The burgers are great. Lots to choose from. Tried the gauc one but you couldn't even taste the quac. The one with the egg is dynamo.  And there's bottomless fries :) Service is good. Highly recommended and a great cheat meal.

Highly Impressed for my first trip EVER (shocking I know!) Ordered the Meal that made them Famous the Red Robin Gourmet Cheeseburger. Never though a burger could ever taste so good, nor that Relish on a burger would be AWSOME! However what prevented the 5th star was the odd placement of this restaurant as if it was a afterthought to build there. Also the front waiting area is VERY cramp, get more then 3-4 people waiting and you get to become friends VERY well. Regardless of that, I am a fan and will return for takeout even!

Went to red robin for the first time in awhile and was very disappointed. The girl who waited on us was good but the food took forever to come out probably about 40 minutes(it use to come out in 10-12 mins)The salad was crappy and full of greens that looked like the weeds in my front yard, and the bathroom was absolutely disgusting. I have no idea what is going on around there I always felt this was the best location of all the red robins and now I am not so sure. I think if they worried less about the new remodel and more about the customer they would be a lot better off. As I was leaving I heard other tables complaining about the wait time on food as well. It will be a very long time before I go back.

Red Robin....Yum! And Yum is right. I used to work at the Radioshack across the street so Ive ordered here many times. The Bacon Cheeseburger is the way to go. Bottomless fries = Winning!  Make sure you get the Campfire sauce for dipping! Bacon Cheeseburger 1-5=5. Fries 1-5=4.
Took my girlfriend here last week and we had a great time. Burger was good, not great. Service was fantastic and the blood orange margarita was excellent. Can't go wrong with bottomless fries.
Great food and wonderful service!!! Awesome burgers, onion rings, fries and clam chowder.

Aweful dining experience.  Service was terrible, food was just as bad.  First we were sat in the back of the restaurant with  about five or six other tables all next to each other.  The rest of dining room was near empty.  All these tables were being covered by one server.  Other servers were seen just standing around or wiping an occasional table.  We had an appetizer and a so called bowl of chili.  The chili portion would not fill a cup let alone a bowl.  Then our main courses came,  both portion sizes were easily rivaled by a McDonald's happy meal.  The "bottomless fries" did not matter because the server never returned and offered to get us more.  We were completely done with our meals before he ever came back.  At one point he took my glass of tea to refill and after 15 minutes I had to ask if he could bring it back.  My wife's meal sat getting cold because they had brought the wrong dipping sauce with it and she was waiting to have it corrected.  The last time for this place.  If I could give it zero stars I would.

We love Red Robin's, but not this location. First, the service was sub-par.  It may have been the guy's first week or something...but he forgot stuff constantly and was very slow.  When the food finally did arrive (after nearly 45 minutes) it was inconsistent.  Both burgers were ordered the same temperature, but one came out heavily brown on the inside and the other came out looking like it had only stopped mooing minutes prior.  The manager walked around and really did nothing to help anyone.  The most positive part of the night was the tower of onion rings which are to die for!  Red Robin's makes them the best!  Overall though, just a very average, albeit slow experience.  It's not one that would make us consider this place as a "must patronize" or "top of the list" candidate

This experience was definitely disappointing to say the least. Once again, thought this would be a casual, kid-friendly joint so I wanted to give it a go. First tip-off, there weren't any hosts readily available to put my name in on the wait list. I should learn first red flag means bail. The decor however is awesome. I love the set-up and love the mini arcade they have to occupy your time before or after dinner.  The freckled lemonade tastes awesome and it includes bottomless refills which is a good thing considering it's quite pricey for a non-alcoholic beverage. The menu has a lot of options, it took me a awhile to decide on something. I wanted to try a lot of things. My server was quite accommodating when it came to fulfilling my requests of how I wanted my order. However, I asked for my son's mac & cheese to come out with our appetizers. The apps came but the mac didn't. The waitress said she'd check on it but I didn't see her again until after my food had arrived, still no sign of the mac. By this time my son had filled up on my entree and apps. When we were almost finished she came out with the mac. I told her we didn't want it. Then the manager came over and took care of things but then the server disappeared. From there the manager became our server. So that definitely bothered me. All in all I think the food is great, the selection on the menu is more than I expected and the decor is perfect to keep your child entertained until the food arrives. This particular Red Robin though hasn't quite aced the customer service aspect.

I avoid Red Robin for several reasons:  1) It's a chain.  2) It's always crowded.  3) It attracts children.  4) Creepy, tights-wearing mascot. Despite those reasons, I get irresistible cravings for Red Robin sometimes... not for the burgers, which I haven't tasted in years, but for the "fish burger," which is really just a fish filet sandwich.  In fact, it's got two delicious, crispy breaded fish filets, a bunch of pickles, a succulent dilly tartar sauce, and shredded cabbage.  It's by far the best fish sandwich in town.   The trademark seasoned steak fries are quite good as well, and ketchup lovers like me will appreciate the multiple ounces of ketchup you can scoop up with each one.  It's nice that they refill your fries for free, but I've never been able to take advantage of it because I'm always full. They've got some tasty N/A mixed drinks here, like a lime/raspberry thing served in a ridiculous glass that cost like $5 but I had to have it anyway.  At least it had free refills... I've never seen any sort of drink like this with free refills anywhere else.  Speaking of drinks, I like that they have a full bar here.  I rarely get alcohol at restaurants, though having a bar at a family-friendly place like this is, I think, a nod to parents that they're allowed to have a little fun, too, when they take their kids out to supper.   That said, last time I ate at this location, there were four men at a nearby table, talking loudly about subjects that should not be talked about in a family restaurant.  They were so loud that we asked to change tables, and our waitress apologized, comped some of our food, and explained the men had been there drinking all day long.  How pathetic is that?  But Red Robin's response was the best they could do without throwing the guys out, so kudos to them.
Stopped by for lunch.  Red Robin makes a good burger in a nice, relaxed atmosphere.  It's not going to change your world, but it's definitely worth the step up from the McDs across the parking lot.

I'm rating this place a 1. The only reason I can rate it this high is because our waitress was excellent. The food? Well that's another story.  First off I really enjoy a good cheeseburger. Sometimes even more so then a steak or some seafood dish. As my partner and I are driving to Red Robin, I'm telling her how good the hamburgers are. I had been to a Red Robin a few years back so I was speaking from a prior experience. I think it's safe to say I won't be picking the next place to eat out at for a long time after this experience.  We each had a 'schroom' burger which is essentially a cheeseburger with mushrooms. This burger was positively the worst hamburger I have ever had, bar none. It's not just me either as my date has an even worse opinion of her mushroom burger. How they made this thing or for that matter what the meat actually was is a mystery to me but the thing was totally TASTELESS. No flavor to the meat whatsoever. Absolutely nothing! Halfway through trying to eat this thing I pulled back the bun to see what the hell was in there (all the while my date is smothering hers with salt and wishing she had asked for mayo or mustard or just about anything to give her burger some taste). As I looked at the hamburger I can honestly say it didn't even look like a hamburger. She agreed. Nowhere on the hamburger could I find any trace of the thing being browned. What do they do boil these things? The only positive thing I can say about this mushroom burger is that the mushrooms were good. If you haven't already guessed, if I ever see another Red Robin again I'll be driving right by. As a side note, after eating this burger my stomach, and hers for that matter, completely agree with this review.

Went because the word is out that Red Robin now has a vegan burger option. Yep. They do. They charge over $9 for it too. Can make something much better at home for less than a third of the price.  There were lots of kids there too. Which is cool if you have kids, but not so much when you don't.  I guess the only plus side is that it's nice to know there's another place to go when meat eating friends want a burger...

I ate dinner here with my brother a couple weeks back - my first time at a Red Robin.  Apparently they're Zagat rated for having the "best burgers", so I had to order one.  I had the Bleu Ribbon Burger, which features chipotle mayo, blue cheese crumbles, and fried onion strings.  The burger didn't disappoint.  I'm a sucker for blue cheese crumbles on a hamburger, so it would have been pretty hard for them to screw it up. Burgers are the big draw to this place ... I'd have to say that their hamburgers are pretty much on par with those from other casual dining restaurants (eg. Chili's, Applebees), but they have a lot more variety.  For example, they have a burger marinated in teriyaki sauce and topped with pineapple and another with fried jalapenos, cayenne pepper, and salsa.  They also have about four or five different bun options, plus they'll let you customize any burger with extra toppings. If I find myself back in the easton area and hungry, I'll be back.

Was in Columbus for a wedding and just checked into our hotel when we saw Red Robin.  It's basically the same Red Robin whereever you go, nothing special but nothing really bad either.  The food was decent, the waitstaff was friendly and quick, always kept our drinks full.

First and foremost, the kids love this place, so in my book, it is already a winner.  Free refills on fries is always a big hit as well.  Kids had a corn dog and pizza tonite and I had the Southwest Chicken salad.  The fried jalapeno's on the salad spiced it up just right.  As always, the staff was kid centric, so we will be back.

Love the mushroom swiss burger. I've find a new favorite. But I may go back and flirt with my old flame the guacamole burger. Neither will  dissapoint. Add the endless fries and it's a winner. Our server was also very good. Attentive and fun.

The positives: I really like the burgers here. They are the best burgers you can get from a sit-down place. The atmosphere is really neat. Place looks cool.  The negatives: The price is really high. The servers here were average, but not overly friendly. They were alright, but not very prompt. The place was not very packed. We went there approx 2PM. The approx visit was early April 2010.  Only reason It is getting 4 stars is becuase of the price. This location is also more expensive then usual locations. It may becuase it is new. I ate at another location and it was 2 dollars or 3 dollars cheaper.

Two words come to mind: *simulacra* and *creepy* Remember the scene in "Pulp Fiction" where Uma Thurman and John Travolta go to Jack Rabbit Slim's, and everything is supposed to be all 1950's ("Would you like the Martin and Lewis or the Amos and Andy?") - yeah, and it's basically a hollow reproduction of an ideal 1950s that never existed? And it's kinda cool, right, because we want to remember the 1950s like that... well imagine the same kind of thing, but without being able to choose your hamburger's well-doneness as "bloody as hell," and with the encapsulated moment being not the pretty cool 1950s, but the gorgingly excessive 2000s.  My friend and I sort of happened upon this place since we had to go to Best Buy for something (btw: never again!), and suddenly found ourselves famished. Options at Easton being pretty limited, we settled upon Red Robin because of their purported "gourmet burgers." In My mind, gourmet means some bloody sloppy mess that is possibly still mooing and which also involves fresh romaine lettice, freshly sliced tomatoes, perhaps some gouda or otherwise gourmet cheese, and uber alles... NO conveyor belt cooking. I mean, honestly. I realize this is a chain restaurant (even though I'd only vaguely heard of it), but so is the Hard Rock Cafe, and I feel like I've eaten bloody half-mooing hamburgery goodness there before, even if it wasn't the best ever. Our experience at Red Robin was actually so... compelling... that we ended up going home and watching "Waiting" after.  To summarize: yes, the onion rings were good. I don't normally eat this type of food, so I don't actually have much to go off, though. The waiter actually told us that the burgers were made on a conveyor belt (gourmet - lies!! All lies!), and that rare or even medium rare was not an option. Both of our burgers were good enough, but you know. The were good enough, Considering. I was also not a fan of the garlic-butter-somethin' fries that our friendly waiter INSISTED i try.  Mainly we were completely distracted by the somewhat creepy sensory overload of this place - everything corporate, capitalistic and evil about America was reproduced in bright, glowing kitsch. It's hard to describe because between our textbook-friendly waiter and the enormous cow suspended from the ceiling, we were a bit overwhelemed. It's hard to believe that a whole sector of the American public really does enjoy this type of thing (people seemed very happy) - but my incredulousness is only my point of view; I certainly don't fault people for being themselves. I can't help noting, though, that places like this are why many foreigners think we're gluttonous chumps... Mon dieu.

I finally got to go to  Red Robin, been wanting to go since they came to Columbus.  Went to lunch here yesterday.  Very good I must say.  Dane was our server.  Cute stocky guy with a mustache and beard.  I had the royal red robin burger which had bacon, egg, cheese, grilled onions, lettuce and tomato.  The egg was a bit over cooked, but over all it was delicious.  My friend with me had a fried chicken burger with everything on it.  I ate my fries, which were very good and seasoned well, and half my burger, so did she.  We both got fries to take home to eat later with other half of burger.  They are good heated up in a toaster or regular oven for a few minutes.  Dane was a very good server and was compensated well.  An extra dollar for charm and being a cutie pie.  Ha, Ha, Ha.   The prices are moderate.  Good value for the money.

We have dined at this Red Robins on several occasions and absolutely love their burgers and all you can eat fries.  The burgers are fresh, BIG and quite tasty.  The french fries are huge "steak fries" and you can eat all you want.  Love this place and the prices are quite reasonable.

I honestly thought that the only entres on the menu were burgers until just a minute ago when I looked it up online. But realistically the only thing worth getting on the menu are their burgers. And they have plenty to choose from with toppings as wide and varied such as eggs, shrooms, pot roast, pineapple and guacamole just to name a few. Did I mention bottomless fries? Well I just did. I should also mention that they keep a bottle of seasoned salt at the table so you can season your own fries. As much as I don't want to give a giant corporate restaurant a title like "best burger", they come pretty darn close. They certainly have some pretty creative chefs working at corporate to come up with burgers that not only make you raise an eyebrow, but that taste great as well. Since this Red Robin is located at Easton, be prepared for crowds during the weekends. And dinners. And random times throughout the year. Make the most of it by ordering a fancy overpriced drink in a neat glass. You know what I mean.

How is it a gourmet burger if you aren't allowed to order it cooked to order?  I asked for mine cooked medium, and was told that everything is cooked well done regardless.  Gross and will not be returning.  Nothing impressive about anything else we ate there either.

We love their steak fries and those alone are reason enough to go but man their burgers have gone downhill.  When you order medium or medium well and it comes back so dry you have to take a drink with every bite, something is wrong.  If you like your burgers burnt, this place is for you.  Too bad, seems to be the trend with the burger places around Easton.

This location is a little tired and the employee efforts (especially those in the kitchen) are lackluster.  The salad we were served had several pieces of brown/old lettuce and the chicken sandwich I ordered was missing several key components.  The service is good, but not exceptional.  The cleanliness is questionable at times - confirmed by a friend and current employee who let it slip that the kitchen always is rated low for sanitation and safety during various franchise inspections.

Red Robin is a large burger chain serving up LARGE burgers in a gawdy atmosphere. I have two young nephews and this is were they wanted to go. And I can see why.  Lots of visual noise going on.  The meals were the usual American obese portions of greasy saltiness. Our waitress was great - and deserves five stars on her own accord.  I ordered a boca burger which was twice as thick as any boca burger I've ever had.  It wasn't really cooked well at all and was barely warm.  I was hoping for some crusty veggie goodness.  But alas it was squishy dry blandness.   I had the choice to have it prepared as any of their other burgers but always try to avoid zany sauces and toppings. Hey it's a chain burger joint.  You'll get your moneys worth and have leftovers.  It wouldn't be my first choice, but if you want a greasy  fist-full-o-burger the size of your enlarged heart = then this is the place to go.

Typical Red Robin.  This place gets slammed with people during the weekday lunch rush.  Always a good burger and the endless fries are nice.  Nothing to complain about but nothing that really wows you.
